intro: Juanulloa verrucosa, commonly known as the rough-stemmed Juanulloa, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its rough, ridged stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces yellowish flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Juanulloa verrucosa is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats.
